examples: The car is so dirty, we need to wash it.
Dishwashers wash dishes way more efficiently than most humans.
This new washing powder rlly wash es bedclothes superwhite .

definitions.definition: To carry away or erode by the force of water in motion.
examples: Don't pour that in the drain; it will wash downstream.
Heavy rains wash a road or an embankment.
The remaining flotsam was washed ashore.

definitions.definition: To be eroded or carried away by the action of water.
To separate valuable material (such as gold) from worthless material by the action of flowing water.

examples: I wash every morning after getting up.

definitions.definition: To cover with water or any liquid; to wet ; to fall on and moisten.
To move with a lapping or swashing sound; to lap or splash .
To be cogent , convincing ; to withstand critique .
To bear without damage the operation of being washed; to be suitable for washing.
To cover with a thin or watery coat of colour ; to tint lightly and thinly.
To overlay with a thin coat of metal .
To cause dephosphorization of ( molten pig iron ) by adding substances containing iron oxide, and sometimes manganese oxide.
To pass (a gas or gaseous mixture) through or over a liquid for the purpose of purifying it, especially by removing soluble constituents .
To mix up tiles (before a new game) to make them random; to shuffle .

secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To carry away or erode by the force of water in motion.
( intransitive ) To be eroded or carried away by the action of water.
( mining ) To separate valuable material (such as gold) from worthless material by the action of flowing water.
( intransitive ) To clean oneself with water.
( transitive ) To cover with water or any liquid; to wet ; to fall on and moisten.
( intransitive ) To move with a lapping or swashing sound; to lap or splash .
( intransitive , figuratively ) To be cogent , convincing ; to withstand critique .
( intransitive ) To bear without damage the operation of being washed; to be suitable for washing.
( transitive ) To cover with a thin or watery coat of colour ; to tint lightly and thinly.
( transitive ) To overlay with a thin coat of metal .
( transitive ) To cause dephosphorization of ( molten pig iron ) by adding substances containing iron oxide, and sometimes manganese oxide.
( transitive ) To pass (a gas or gaseous mixture) through or over a liquid for the purpose of purifying it, especially by removing soluble constituents .
( mah-jong ) To mix up tiles (before a new game) to make them random; to shuffle .
